lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau sumyr aUc Acl Agm Aiq pwvk pvn jl ibAwp n skq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Soumayr Ooch Achal Agam Ati , Paavak Pavan Jal Biaap N Sakat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As Sumer mountain is believed to be very high, immovable and inaccessible, it is least influenced by fire, air and water;

lines.gurmukhi: pwvk pRgws qws bwnI caugunI cVq paun gOn DUir dUir hoie cmkiq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Paavak Pragaas Taas Baanee Chaougounee Charhata , Paoun Gaoun Dhoori Doori Hoi Chamakati Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: It shines and blazes in fire many times more while the air removes its dust making it glitter far more,

lines.gurmukhi: sMgm sll mlu Doie inrml krY hrY duK dyK suin sujs bkiq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sangam Salal Malu Dhoi Niramal Karai , Harai Doukh Daykh Souni Sujas Bakati Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Water pouring on it makes it clean washing away all its dross. It dispels the distresses of the world by providing them with many herbs and medicinal plants. Because of all these virtuous qualities, people sing the glory of Sumer mountain.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK jogI qiRgun AcIq cIq sRI gur sbd rs AMmiRq Ckiq hY ]360]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikh Jogee Trigoun Acheet Cheeta , Sree Gur Sabad Ras Anmrit Chhakati Hai ?360?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the mind of the Sikhs attached with the lotus feet of Guru is free from the triple influence of maya (mammon). He accumulates no dross. Like Sumer mountain, he is stable, inaccessible, pious, free of all dross of vices and who allay others suffe
